result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jadon M. Wade

Hayes has no record to make.  State requests warrant. Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.

02:33 PM Defendant Jadon M. Wade in court, in custody from LEC w/atty. Hayes.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jadon M. Wade appeared by video means.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised rights to an attorney.  DE qualifies for PD representation.  State requests $ signature bond.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $500.00 SIGNATUE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No violent, physical or abusive contact w/G.P.D.W. or S.L.P.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
